solution_line_template: A jar of almond butter costs {ab_pb_cost_ratio} * {pb_jar_cost} = $<<{ab_pb_cost_ratio}*{pb_jar_cost}={ab_jar_cost}>>{ab_jar_cost}.
It takes half a jar to make a batch of cookies, so it costs {ab_jar_cost} / {jar_per_batch} = $<<{ab_jar_cost}/{jar_per_batch}={ab_batch_cost}>>{ab_batch_cost} to use almond butter.
It costs {pb_jar_cost} / {jar_per_batch} = $<<{pb_jar_cost}/{jar_per_batch}={pb_batch_cost}>>{pb_batch_cost} to use peanut butter.

Thus, it costs {ab_batch_cost} - {pb_batch_cost} = $<<{ab_batch_cost}-{pb_batch_cost}={batch_cost_difference}>>{batch_cost_difference} more to make a batch of almond butter cookies than peanut butter cookies.
